column4: ive used ubuntu tweak to set a custom logo/ login screen..and  neither are showing. the one it had before is gone but now its just a purplish dotted line default one
make sure that file is readable by *everyone*, since lightdm has its own user
i went to tweaks/login settings ( then had to unlock the settings ) clicked the pic like it said to add and selected one for icon one for background from my pics folder.
just allowed all permissions.. brb trying
yeah didnt work.
is it a problem that to change the pic i have to reenter my authentication on every restart?
in ubuntu tweak settings i mean
anyone know what else to do? should i change the group the pic is in or .. ? *shrug*
you there?
Stanley: yeah didnt work allowing full permission
did you change all the path, or just the file permission?
should i change the group the pic belongs to or..? also does it matter that i have to authenticate in ubuntu tweak settings every restart in order to access settings?
stanley: i just right clicked properties the pic and checked marked the allow all boxes and the ability to run as prog or w/e box
where did you put that pic?
home/computer/pics
how about move that pic to /home, and chmod +r it, in terminal "sudo mv /path/to/pic /home; sudo chmod +r /home/pic.png"
stanley : just says no such file or directory found..
did you know what mv and chmod do?
ah, sorry for my bad English :(
stanley: nope no idea. just copy pasted what you said and inserted my pic path and all. no youre fine..ive only been on linux like a week so sitll super new
well, can you give me the full path to your picture, and I will give you a working command
